data.text: We are 1 week into a 9 day stay. I have been to Egypt several times before, previously staying in larger hotels as travelling with children. I was a little wary after reading reviews here but I needn't have worried. Amar Sina has been a perfect getaway. It may be a little dated in places but the rustic charm far outweighs the corporate blandness I have experienced in larger hotels. The staff are warm and welcoming and will do all they can to make your stay as relaxing as possible. I will definitely return here without any hesitation. As we have met many returning visitors we are not alone in appreciating the opportunity to enjoy the calm, relaxing atmosphere the Amar Sina delivers. The staff are like one big family and all work so hard. The food is fresh and tasty, not a chip or chicken nugget in sight.
data.title: A truly relaxing holiday. An absolute gem ðŸ’Ž

data.text: no hot water in my room shower. the food i couldent eat, only friday the food was good and i ate grilled fish and deserts. many times asked that my hot water dosent work there was no response. no internet in my room only in reception. manager asked me to stay in my freinds room last day which i denied and was disgusted at his suggestion. mosqitoes were biting me everyday at night at hotel and were in my room.
data.title: disgusting

user_location.name: Dagenham, Barking and Dagenham, Greater London, England

data.text:
Donâ€™t waste your money.
Food is gross and pretty much the same everyday, Some days we got the same slop for lunch and dinner and sometimes even breakfast ! Thank God for the Italian restaurant down the road and the fabulous Naama Bay or we would have starved.  We ended up eating out 10 nights out of 14 and only bothered with 2 breakfasts as bread & omelettes were the only edible things  AI drinks are a joke. 3 very cheap soft drinks and 3 cheap spirits was your choice. No beer. Any drink was given in a very small plastic glass containing a couple of mouthfuls and the service of them was definitely not with a smile.
First room we were given a vagrant wouldnâ€™t have stayed in. The second was better but still not acceptable. Old broken furniture, bad electrics, TV from the 60s and broken shower. Iâ€™m sure the room was really nice when it first opened 20+ years ago but like the rest of the hotel it has been badly neglected. The only saving graces were that the bed was very comfortable and the cleaners did a good job cleaning and supplying fresh bed linen, towels and bog roll
The pool and pool area was dirty and in need of repairs. One day they washed the area where the sun beds and parasols were and brushed the water into the pool ! There is nowhere near enough sun-beds and parasols for the amount of guests, not that the hotel was particularly busy and the sun beds were â€˜towelledâ€™ by 8am everyday. The animation team, was 1 person and he tried his best, but on some days there was literally no entertainment and there was zero at night. 
There was a free bus laid on every morning and afternoon to take you to 1 of 2 beaches about 20 minutes away. The first beach was awful - cramped, no toilets and you had to walk up and down a hundred steep, dangerous and broken steps to get there. Definitely not suitable for kids, elderly or disabled. The second beach was better but the bus only went there at 2pm and picked you up at 5 so only 3 hours. 
The location is not great either. There are a few shops around and one or 2 pay per day beaches belonging to better hotels but thatâ€™s about it. Thankfully the Old Town and Naama Bay are only a 20 minute taxi ride away to get away from the area. 
There is a small, pitiful animal farm at the hotel, which should be closed down immediately. I felt so sorry for the poor, diseased & neglected creatures. At least the humans have a choice whether or not to stay at the hotel. 
If you are staying here for one night then this is a cheap basic hotel and you probably wonâ€™t be too bothered with all the faults but if youâ€™re staying any longer, book any other hotel in Sharm, it couldnâ€™t be worse. It will be worth paying Â£200 or Â£300 more I promise you. I can only imagine that any positive reviews on this site are either fake or from overnight stayers.
data.title: Just donâ€™t do it. Poor hostel

data.text:
We booked this hotel knowing it would be basic based on the priceâ€¦but it was beyond basicâ€¦the first room we were given at 11pm had a flood of ammonia smelling liquid outside itâ€™s doorâ€¦and we had two kids beds pushed together with mattresses what may as well have been made from pink wafer biscuitsâ€¦the front door did not lockâ€¦the shower was broken and not even the word primitive describes it-(imagine having to put shoes ON to use the bathroom, it was that gross)-the air con couldnâ€™t be turned off and sounded like an aircraft in distress-(or maybe I was subconsciously wailing?)â€¦first thing the next morning we complained and we told no problem, come back at 12â€¦(they clearly knew how hideous that room is)â€¦got changed to a much better looking/smelling roomâ€¦however, in 24 hours we had water pouring from the shower upstairs into our shower cubicle-(and I do mean pouring)-it was fixedâ€¦but happened againâ€¦was fixed and happened againâ€¦and no doubt because of this water issue, we lost all electrics 3 times for long periods of timeâ€¦we asked to change again and they said there were no roomsâ€¦we had a heated discussion where the lad at reception didnâ€™t care at allâ€¦we ended up moving-at our own cost-to another AMAZING hotel, who had heard from other holiday makers just how awful the Amar Sina isâ€¦please do not think youâ€™re getting a right bargain, youâ€™re not, youâ€™re over paying for a hell hole where no staff are happy in their jobs yet still expect tipsâ€¦where the food is so bland that youâ€™re only tasty option is the bread rolls-(for breakfast, dinner and tea)â€¦Iâ€™ve never been somewhere where there isnâ€™t even beer on AI, you have to pay for water if you donâ€™t want it room temperature from a dirty water buttâ€¦there are no hand towelsâ€¦no shower matâ€¦as I started out this review-it is beyond basicâ€¦if I could rate it zero, I would.DO.NOT.STAY.HERE.

I love Egypt and I will still be returning, but never ever to this â€˜hotelâ€™
data.title: Awful, terrible â€˜hotelâ€™

data.text: I arrived at the hotel after a late flight, booked via booking.com using my credit card. The terms of the booking are very clear in English. You pay via booking.com and it is not refundable. I was t carrying any money with me for safety purposes and used the card system to pay via booking.com only to arrive at the hotel and be told that they only accept cash payment. They stated that they had no facility for card payments yet they have the VISA card sticker on their doors. I had to book somewhere else urgently so that I had somewhere to go. They were so aggressive with the way they handled the situation that they walked me to a shop to try and get cash back. Unfortunately there are many crooks in Egypt and this place is one of them.
data.title: Absolutely awful and a bunch of thieves
